rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: حمٓ
rows.translation: Ha. Mim.
rows.transliteration: ḥā mīm

rows.arabic: وَٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
rows.translation: By the Scripture which maketh plain,
rows.transliteration: wal kitābil mubīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَـٰهُ قُرْءَٰنًا عَرَبِيًّا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: Lo! We have appointed it a Lecture, in Arabic that haply ye may understand.
rows.transliteration: innā ja`alnāhu qur-ānan `arabiyyal la`allakum ta`qilūn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ فِىٓ أُمِّ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَدَيْنَا لَعَلِىٌّ حَكِيمٌ
rows.translation: And Lo! in the Source of Decrees, which We possess, it is indeed sublime, decisive.
rows.transliteration: wa innahu fī ummil kitābi ladaynā la`aliyyun ḥakīm

rows.arabic: أَفَنَضْرِبُ عَنكُمُ ٱلذِّكْرَ صَفْحًا أَن كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا مُّسْرِفِينَ
rows.translation: Shall We utterly ignore you because ye are a wanton folk?
rows.transliteration: afanaḍribu `ankumudh dhikra ṣafḥan an kuntum qawman musrifīn

rows.arabic: وَكَمْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن نَّبِىٍّ فِى ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: How many a prophet did We send among the men of old!
rows.transliteration: wakam arsalnā min nabiyyin fil-awwalīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن نَّبِىٍّ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
rows.translation: And never came there unto them a prophet but they used to mock him.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ya-tīhim min nabiyyin illā kānū bihi yastahzi-ūn

rows.arabic: فَأَهْلَكْنَآ أَشَدَّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًا وَمَضَىٰ مَثَلُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: Then We destroyed men mightier than these in prowess; and the example of the men of old hath gone (before them).
rows.transliteration: fa-ahlaknā ashadda minhum baṭshan wa maḍā mathalul-awwalīn

rows.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ لَيَقُولُنَّ خَلَقَهُنَّ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: And if thou (Muhammad) ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth, they will surely answer: The Mighty, the Knower created them;
rows.transliteration: wala-in sa-altahum man khalaqas samāwāti wal-arḍa layaqūlunna khalaqahunnal `azīzul `alīm

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ مَهْدًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: Who made the earth a resting-place for you, and placed roads for you therein, that haply ye may find your way;
rows.transliteration: alladhī ja`ala lakumul-arḍa mahdan waja`ala lakum fīhā subulal la`allakum tahtadūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِى نَزَّلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۢ بِقَدَرٍ فَأَنشَرْنَا بِهِۦ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ تُخْرَجُونَ
rows.translation: And Who sendeth down water from the sky in (due) measure, and We revive a dead land therewith. Even so will ye be brought forth;
rows.transliteration: wal ladhī nazzala minas samā-i mā-an biqadarin fa-ansharnā bihi baldatan maytā ۚ kadhālika tukhrajūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلْأَزْوَٰجَ كُلَّهَا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْفُلْكِ وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ مَا تَرْكَبُونَ
rows.translation: He Who created all the pairs, and appointed for you ships and cattle whereupon ye ride.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhī khalaqal-azwāja kullahā waja`ala lakum minal fulki wal-an`āmi mā tarkabūn

rows.arabic: لِتَسْتَوُۥا۟ عَلَىٰ ظُهُورِهِۦ ثُمَّ تَذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَةَ رَبِّكُمْ إِذَا ٱسْتَوَيْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ وَتَقُولُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱلَّذِى سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَـٰذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُۥ مُقْرِنِينَ
rows.translation: That ye may mount upon their backs, and may remember your Lord's favour when ye mount thereon, and may say: Glorified be He Who hath subdued these unto us, and we were not capable (of subduing them);
rows.transliteration: litastawu `alā ẓuhūrihi thumma tadhkurū ni`mata rabbikum idhas-tawaytum `alayhi wataqūlū subḥānal ladhī sakhhara lanā hādhā wa mā kunnā lahu muqrinīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا لَمُنقَلِبُونَ
rows.translation: And lo! unto our Lord we surely are returning.
rows.transliteration: wa innā ilā rabbinā lamunqalibūn

rows.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا۟ لَهُۥ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ جُزْءًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَكَفُورٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: And they allot to Him a portion of His bondmen! Lo! man is verily a mere ingrate.
rows.transliteration: waja`alū lahu min `ibādihi juz-ā ۚ innal-insāna lakafūrun mubīn

rows.arabic: أَمِ ٱتَّخَذَ مِمَّا يَخْلُقُ بَنَاتٍ وَأَصْفَىٰكُم بِٱلْبَنِينَ
rows.translation: Or chooseth He daughters of all that He hath created, and honoureth He you with sons?
rows.transliteration: amit-takhadha mimmā yakhluqu banātin wa-aṣfākum bil banīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِمَا ضَرَبَ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مَثَلًا ظَلَّ وَجْهُهُۥ مُسْوَدًّا وَهُوَ كَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: And if one of them hath tidings of that which he likeneth to the Beneficent One, his countenance becometh black and he is full of inward rage.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā bushhira aḥaduhum bimā ḍaraba lirraḥmāni mathalan ẓalla wajhuhu muswaddan wahuwa kaẓīm

rows.arabic: أَوَمَن يُنَشَّؤُا۟ فِى ٱلْحِلْيَةِ وَهُوَ فِى ٱلْخِصَامِ غَيْرُ مُبِينٍ
rows.translation: (Liken they then to Allah) that which is bred up in outward show, and in dispute cannot make itself plain?
rows.transliteration: awa man yunashha-u fil ḥilyati wahuwa fil khiṣāmi ghayru mubīn

rows.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا۟ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عِبَـٰدُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ إِنَـٰثًا ۚ أَشَهِدُوا۟ خَلْقَهُمْ ۚ سَتُكْتَبُ شَهَـٰدَتُهُمْ وَيُسْـَٔلُونَ
rows.translation: And they make the angels, who are the slaves of the Beneficent, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded and they will be questioned.
rows.transliteration: waja`alul malā-ikatal ladhīna hum `ibādur raḥmāni ināthā ۚ ashahidū khalqahum ۚ satuktabu shahādatuhum wayus-alūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْ شَآءَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ مَا عَبَدْنَـٰهُم ۗ مَّا لَهُم بِذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَخْرُصُونَ
rows.translation: And they say: If the Beneficent One had (so) willed, we should not have worshipped them. They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do but guess.
rows.transliteration: waqālū law shā-ar raḥmānu mā `abadnāhum ۗ mā lahum bidhālika min `il-m ۖ in hum illā yakhruṣūn

rows.arabic: أَمْ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ كِتَـٰبًا مِّن قَبْلِهِۦ فَهُم بِهِۦ مُسْتَمْسِكُونَ
rows.translation: Or have We given them any scripture before (this Qur'an) so that they are holding fast thereto?
rows.transliteration: am ātaynāhum kitāban min qablihi fahum bihi mustamsikūn

rows.arabic: بَلْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا عَلَىٰٓ أُمَّةٍ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَـٰرِهِم مُّهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: Nay, for they say only: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are guided by their footprints.
rows.transliteration: bal qālū innā wajadnā ābā-anā `alā ummatin wa innā `alā āthārihim muhtadūn

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِى قَرْيَةٍ مِّن نَّذِيرٍ إِلَّا قَالَ مُتْرَفُوهَآ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا عَلَىٰٓ أُمَّةٍ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَـٰرِهِم مُّقْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: And even so We sent not a warner before thee (Muhammad) into any township but its luxurious ones said: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are following their footprints.
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika mā arsalnā min qablika fī qaryatim min nadhīrin illā qāla mutrafūhā innā wajadnā ābā-anā `alā ummatin wa innā `alā āthārihim muqtadūn

rows.arabic: قَـٰلَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكُم بِأَهْدَىٰ مِمَّا وَجَدتُّمْ عَلَيْهِ ءَابَآءَكُمْ ۖ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا بِمَآ أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِۦ كَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: (And the warner) said: What! Even though I bring you better guidance than that ye found your fathers following? They answered: Lo! in what ye bring we are disbelievers.
rows.transliteration: qāla awalaw ji-tukum bi-ahdā mimmā wajadtum `alayhi ābā-akum ۖ qālū innā bimā ursiltum bihi kāfirūn

rows.arabic: فَٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
rows.translation: So We requited them. Then see the nature of the consequence for the rejecters!
rows.transliteration: fantaqamnā minhum ۖ fanẓur kayfa kāna `āqibatul mukadhhibīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّنِى بَرَآءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: And when Abraham said unto his father and his folk: Lo! I am innocent of what ye worship
rows.transliteration: wa idh qāla ibrāhīmu li-abīhi waqawmihi innanī barā-un mimmā ta`budūn

rows.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِى فَطَرَنِى فَإِنَّهُۥ سَيَهْدِينِ
rows.translation: Save Him Who did create me, for He will surely guide me.
rows.transliteration: illal ladhī faṭaranī fa-innahu sayahdīn

rows.arabic: وَجَعَلَهَا كَلِمَةًۢ بَاقِيَةً فِى عَقِبِهِۦ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
rows.translation: And he made it a word enduring among his seed, that haply they might return.
rows.transliteration: waja`alahā kalimatan bāqiyatan fī `aqibihi la`allahum yarji`ūn

rows.arabic: بَلْ مَتَّعْتُ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ وَءَابَآءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ وَرَسُولٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: Nay, but I let these and their fathers enjoy life (only) till there should come unto them the Truth and a messenger making plain.
rows.transliteration: bal matta`tu hā-ulā-i wa-ābā-ahum ḥattā jā-ahumul ḥaqqu warasūlun mubīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْحَقُّ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌ وَإِنَّا بِهِۦ كَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: And now that the Truth hath come unto them they say: This is mere magic, and lo! we are disbelievers therein.
rows.transliteration: walammā jā-ahumul ḥaqqu qālū hādhā siḥrun wa innā bihi kāfirūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانُ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنَ ٱلْقَرْيَتَيْنِ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: And they say: If only this Qur'an had been revealed to some great man of the two towns?
rows.transliteration: waqālū lawlā nuzzila hādhal qur-ānu `alā rajulin minal qaryatayni `aẓīm

rows.arabic: أَهُمْ يَقْسِمُونَ رَحْمَتَ رَبِّكَ ۚ نَحْنُ قَسَمْنَا بَيْنَهُم مَّعِيشَتَهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ وَرَفَعْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ فَوْقَ بَعْضٍ دَرَجَـٰتٍ لِّيَتَّخِذَ بَعْضُهُم بَعْضًا سُخْرِيًّا ۗ وَرَحْمَتُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّا يَجْمَعُونَ
rows.translation: Is it they who apportion thy Lord's mercy? We have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of the world, and raised some of them above others in rank that some of them may take labour from others; and the mercy of thy Lord is better than (the wealth) that they amass.
rows.transliteration: ahum yaqsimūna raḥmata rabbik ۚ naḥnu qasamnā baynahum ma`īshatahum fil ḥayātid dunyā ۚ warafa`nā ba`ḍahum fawqa ba`ḍin darajātin liyattakhidha ba`ḍuhum ba`ḍan sukhriyyā ۗ waraḥmatu rabbika khayrun mimmā yajma`ūn

rows.arabic: وَلَوْلَآ أَن يَكُونَ ٱلنَّاسُ أُمَّةً وَٰحِدَةً لَّجَعَلْنَا لِمَن يَكْفُرُ بِٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ لِبُيُوتِهِمْ سُقُفًا مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَمَعَارِجَ عَلَيْهَا يَظْهَرُونَ
rows.translation: And were it not that mankind would have become one community, We might well have appointed, for those who disbelieve in the Beneficent, roofs of silver for their houses and stairs (of silver) whereby to mount,
rows.transliteration: walawlā an yakūnan nāsu ummatan wāḥidatan laja`alnā liman yakfuru bir raḥmāni libuyūtihim suqufan min fiḍḍatin wa ma`ārija `alayhā yaẓharūn

rows.arabic: وَلِبُيُوتِهِمْ أَبْوَٰبًا وَسُرُرًا عَلَيْهَا يَتَّكِـُٔونَ
rows.translation: And for their houses doors (of silver) and couches of silver whereon to recline,
rows.transliteration: walibuyūtihim abwāban wasururan `alayhā yattaki-ūn

rows.arabic: وَزُخْرُفًا ۚ وَإِن كُلُّ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَّا مَتَـٰعُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةُ عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: And ornaments of gold. Yet all that would have been but a provision of the life of the world. And the Hereafter with your Lord would have been for those who keep from evil.
rows.transliteration: wazukhrufā ۚ wa in kullu dhālika lammā matā`ul ḥayātid dunyā ۚ wal-ākhiratu `inda rabbika lil-muttaqīn

rows.arabic: وَمَن يَعْشُ عَن ذِكْرِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ نُقَيِّضْ لَهُۥ شَيْطَـٰنًا فَهُوَ لَهُۥ قَرِينٌ
rows.translation: And he whose sight is dim to the remembrance of the Beneficent, We assign unto him a devil who becometh his comrade;
rows.transliteration: wa man ya`shu `an dhikrir raḥmāni nuqayyiḍ lahu shayṭānan fahuwa lahu qarīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَيَصُدُّونَهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: And lo! they surely turn them from the way of Allah, and yet they deem that they are rightly guided;
rows.transliteration: wa innahum layaṣuddūnahum `anis sabīli wayaḥsabūna annahum muhtadūn

rows.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَنَا قَالَ يَـٰلَيْتَ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَكَ بُعْدَ ٱلْمَشْرِقَيْنِ فَبِئْسَ ٱلْقَرِينُ
rows.translation: Till, when he cometh unto Us, he saith (unto his comrade): Ah, would that between me and thee there were the distance of the two horizons - an evil comrade!
rows.transliteration: ḥattā idhā jā-anā qāla yālayta baynī wabaynaka bu`dal mashriqayni fabi-sal qarīn

rows.arabic: وَلَن يَنفَعَكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ إِذ ظَّلَمْتُمْ أَنَّكُمْ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ مُشْتَرِكُونَ
rows.translation: And it profiteth you not this day, because ye did wrong, that ye will be sharers in the doom.
rows.transliteration: walan yanfa`akumul yawma idh ẓalamtum annakum fil `adhābi mushtarikūn

rows.arabic: أَفَأَنتَ تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ أَوْ تَهْدِى ٱلْعُمْىَ وَمَن كَانَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: Canst thou (Muhammad) make the deaf to hear, or canst thou guide the blind or him who is in error manifest?
rows.transliteration: afa-anta tusmi`uṣ ṣumma aw tahdil `umya wa man kāna fī ḍalālin mubīn

rows.arabic: فَإِمَّا نَذْهَبَنَّ بِكَ فَإِنَّا مِنْهُم مُّنتَقِمُونَ
rows.translation: And if We take thee away, We surely shall take vengeance on them,
rows.transliteration: fa-immā nadh-habanna bika fa-innā minhum muntaqimūn

rows.arabic: أَوْ نُرِيَنَّكَ ٱلَّذِى وَعَدْنَـٰهُمْ فَإِنَّا عَلَيْهِم مُّقْتَدِرُونَ
rows.translation: Or (if) We show thee that wherewith We threaten them; for lo! We have complete command of them.
rows.transliteration: aw nuriyannakal ladhī wa`adnāhum fa-innā `alayhim muqtadirūn

rows.arabic: فَٱسْتَمْسِكْ بِٱلَّذِىٓ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْكَ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
rows.translation: So hold thou fast to that which is inspired in thee. Lo! thou art on a right path.
rows.transliteration: fastamsik bil ladhī ūḥiya ilayk ۖ innaka `alā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَذِكْرٌ لَّكَ وَلِقَوْمِكَ ۖ وَسَوْفَ تُسْـَٔلُونَ
rows.translation: And lo! it is in truth a Reminder for thee and for thy folk; and ye will be questioned.
rows.transliteration: wa innahu ladhikrul laka waliqawmik ۖ wasawfa tus-alūn

rows.arabic: وَسْـَٔلْ مَنْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رُّسُلِنَآ أَجَعَلْنَا مِن دُونِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ءَالِهَةً يُعْبَدُونَ
rows.translation: And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before thee: Did We ever appoint gods to be worshipped beside the Beneficent?
rows.transliteration: was-al man arsalnā min qablika min rusulinā aja`alnā min dūnir raḥmāni ālihatan yu`badūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦ فَقَالَ إِنِّى رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, and he said: I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.
rows.transliteration: walaqad arsalnā mūsā bi-āyātinā ilā fir`awna wa mala-ihi faqāla innī rasūlu rabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِذَا هُم مِّنْهَا يَضْحَكُونَ
rows.translation: But when he brought them Our tokens, behold! they laughed at them.
rows.transliteration: falammā jā-ahum bi-āyātinā idhā hum minhā yaḍ-ḥakūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا نُرِيهِم مِّنْ ءَايَةٍ إِلَّا هِىَ أَكْبَرُ مِنْ أُخْتِهَا ۖ وَأَخَذْنَـٰهُم بِٱلْعَذَابِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
rows.translation: And every token that We showed them was greater than its sister (token), and We grasped them with the torment, that haply they might turn again.
rows.transliteration: wa mā nurīhim min āyatin illā hiya akbaru min ukhtihā ۖ wa-akhadhnāhum bil `adhābi la`allahum yarji`ūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَ ٱلسَّاحِرُ ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ بِمَا عَهِدَ عِندَكَ إِنَّنَا لَمُهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: And they said: O wizard! Entreat thy Lord for us by the pact that He hath made with thee. Lo! we verily will walk aright.
rows.transliteration: waqālū yā-ayyuhas sāḥirud-`u lanā rabbaka bimā `ahida `indaka innanā lamuhtadūn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ إِذَا هُمْ يَنكُثُونَ
rows.translation: But when We eased them of the torment, behold! they broke their word.
rows.transliteration: falammā kashafnā `anhumul `adhāba idhā hum yankuthūn

rows.arabic: وَنَادَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ فِى قَوْمِهِۦ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ أَلَيْسَ لِى مُلْكُ مِصْرَ وَهَـٰذِهِ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِىٓ ۖ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
rows.translation: And Pharaoh caused a proclamation to be made among his people saying: O my people! Is not mine the sovereignty of Egypt and these rivers flowing under me? Can ye not then discern?
rows.transliteration: wanādā fir`awnu fī qawmihi qāla yāqawmi alaysa lī mulku miṣra wahādhihil-anhāru tajrī min taḥtī ۖ afalā tubṣirūn

rows.arabic: أَمْ أَنَا۠ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى هُوَ مَهِينٌ وَلَا يَكَادُ يُبِينُ
rows.translation: I am surely better than this fellow, who is despicable and can hardly make (his meaning) plain!
rows.transliteration: am ana khayrun min hādhal ladhī huwa mahīnun walā yakādu yubīn

rows.arabic: فَلَوْلَآ أُلْقِىَ عَلَيْهِ أَسْوِرَةٌ مِّن ذَهَبٍ أَوْ جَآءَ مَعَهُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ مُقْتَرِنِينَ
rows.translation: Why, then, have armlets of gold not been set upon him, or angels sent along with him?
rows.transliteration: falawlā ulqiya `alayhi aswiratun min dhahabin aw jā-a ma`ahul malā-ikatu muqtarinīn

rows.arabic: فَٱسْتَخَفَّ قَوْمَهُۥ فَأَطَاعُوهُ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا فَـٰسِقِينَ
rows.translation: Thus he persuaded his people to make light (of Moses), and they obeyed him. Lo! they were a wanton folk.
rows.transliteration: fastakhaffa qawmahu fa-aṭā`ūh ۚ innahum kānū qawman fāsiqīn

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّآ ءَاسَفُونَا ٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ فَأَغْرَقْنَـٰهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: So, when they angered Us, We punished them and drowned them every one.
rows.transliteration: falammā āsafūnan-taqamnā minhum fa-aghraqnāhum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ سَلَفًا وَمَثَلًا لِّلْـَٔاخِرِينَ
rows.translation: And We made them a thing past, and an example for those after (them).
rows.transliteration: faja`alnāhum salafan wa mathalal lil-ākhirīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا ضُرِبَ ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ مَثَلًا إِذَا قَوْمُكَ مِنْهُ يَصِدُّونَ
rows.translation: And when the son of Mary is quoted as an example, behold! the folk laugh out,
rows.transliteration: walammā ḍuribab-nu maryama mathalan idhā qawmuka minhu yaṣiddūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوٓا۟ ءَأَـٰلِهَتُنَا خَيْرٌ أَمْ هُوَ ۚ مَا ضَرَبُوهُ لَكَ إِلَّا جَدَلًۢا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ خَصِمُونَ
rows.translation: And say: Are our gods better, or is he? They raise not the objection save for argument. Nay! but they are a contentious folk.
rows.transliteration: waqālū a-ālihatunā khayrun am huw ۚ mā ḍarabūhu laka illā jadalā ۚ bal hum qawmun khaṣimūn

rows.arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا عَبْدٌ أَنْعَمْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ مَثَلًا لِّبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
rows.translation: He is nothing but a slave on whom We bestowed favour, and We made him a pattern for the Children of Israel.
rows.transliteration: in huwa illā `abdun an`amnā `alayhi waja`alnāhu mathalal libanī isrā-iyl

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلْنَا مِنكُم مَّلَـٰٓئِكَةً فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَخْلُفُونَ
rows.translation: And had We willed We could have set among you angels to be viceroys in the earth.
rows.transliteration: walaw nashā-u laja`alnā minkum malā-ikatan fil-arḍi yakhlufūn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَعِلْمٌ لِّلسَّاعَةِ فَلَا تَمْتَرُنَّ بِهَا وَٱتَّبِعُونِ ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
rows.translation: And lo! verily there is knowledge of the Hour. So doubt ye not concerning it, but follow Me. This is the right path.
rows.transliteration: wa innahu la`il-mul lissā`ati falā tamtarunna bihā wattabi`ūn ۚ hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīm

rows.arabic: وَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: And let not Satan turn you aside. Lo! he is an open enemy for you.
rows.transliteration: walā yaṣuddannakumush shayṭān ۖ innahu lakum `aduwwun mubīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَ عِيسَىٰ بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ قَالَ قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِٱلْحِكْمَةِ وَلِأُبَيِّنَ لَكُم بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى تَخْتَلِفُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
rows.translation: When Jesus came with clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty), he said: I have come unto you with wisdom, and to make plain some of that concerning which ye differ. So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.
rows.transliteration: walammā jā-a `īsā bil bayyināti qāla qad ji-tukum bil ḥikmati wali-ubayyina lakum ba`ḍal ladhī takhtalifūna fīh ۖ fattaqullāha wa-aṭī`ūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ رَبِّى وَرَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُوهُ ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
rows.translation: Lo! Allah, He is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is a right path.
rows.transliteration: innallāha huwa rabbī warabbukum fa`budūh ۚ hādhā ṣirāṭun mustaqīm

rows.arabic: فَٱخْتَلَفَ ٱلْأَحْزَابُ مِنۢ بَيْنِهِمْ ۖ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمٍ أَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: But the factions among them differed. Then woe unto those who do wrong from the doom of a painful day.
rows.transliteration: fakhtalafal-aḥzābu min baynihim ۖ fawaylul lilladhīna ẓalamū min `adhābi yawmin alīm

rows.arabic: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ أَن تَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: Await they aught save the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they know not?
rows.transliteration: hal yanẓurūna illas sā`ata an ta-tiyahum baghtatan wahum lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: ٱلْأَخِلَّآءُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بَعْضُهُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ إِلَّا ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: Friends on that day will be foes one to another, save those who kept their duty (to Allah).
rows.transliteration: al-akhillā-u yawma-idhin ba`ḍuhum liba`ḍin `aduwwun illal-muttaqīn

rows.arabic: يَـٰعِبَادِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ وَلَآ أَنتُمْ تَحْزَنُونَ
rows.translation: O My slaves! For you there is no fear this day, nor is it ye who grieve;
rows.transliteration: yā`ibādi lā khawfun `alaykumul yawma walā antum taḥzanūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَكَانُوا۟ مُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: (Ye) who believed Our revelations and were self-surrendered,
rows.transliteration: alladhīna āmanū bi-āyātinā wakānū muslimīn

rows.arabic: ٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ أَنتُمْ وَأَزْوَٰجُكُمْ تُحْبَرُونَ
rows.translation: Enter the Garden, ye and your wives, to be made glad.
rows.transliteration: ud-khulul jannata antum wa-azwājukum tuḥbarūn

rows.arabic: يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِصِحَافٍ مِّن ذَهَبٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ ۖ وَفِيهَا مَا تَشْتَهِيهِ ٱلْأَنفُسُ وَتَلَذُّ ٱلْأَعْيُنُ ۖ وَأَنتُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: Therein are brought round for them trays of gold and goblets, and therein is all that souls desire and eyes find sweet. And ye are immortal therein.
rows.transliteration: yuṭāfu `alayhim biṣiḥāfin min dhahabin wa-akwāb ۖ wafīhā mā tashtahīhil-anfusu wataladhhul-a`yun ۖ wa-antum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْجَنَّةُ ٱلَّتِىٓ أُورِثْتُمُوهَا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: This is the Garden which ye are made to inherit because of what ye used to do.
rows.transliteration: watilkal jannatul latī ūrithtumūhā bimā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: لَكُمْ فِيهَا فَـٰكِهَةٌ كَثِيرَةٌ مِّنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
rows.translation: Therein for you is fruit in plenty whence to eat.
rows.transliteration: lakum fīhā fākihatun kathīratun minhā ta-kulūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ فِى عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: Lo! the guilty are immortal in hell's torment.
rows.transliteration: innal mujrimīna fī `adhābi jahannama khālidūn

rows.arabic: لَا يُفَتَّرُ عَنْهُمْ وَهُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ
rows.translation: It is not relaxed for them, and they despair therein.
rows.transliteration: lā yufattaru `anhum wahum fīhi mublisūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا ظَلَمْنَـٰهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: We wronged them not, but they it was who did the wrong.
rows.transliteration: wa mā ẓalamnāhum walākin kānū humuẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَنَادَوْا۟ يَـٰمَـٰلِكُ لِيَقْضِ عَلَيْنَا رَبُّكَ ۖ قَالَ إِنَّكُم مَّـٰكِثُونَ
rows.translation: And they cry: O master! Let thy Lord make an end of us. He saith: Lo! here ye must remain.
rows.transliteration: wanādaw yāmāliku liyaqḍi `alaynā rabbuk ۖ qāla innakum mākithūn

rows.arabic: لَقَدْ جِئْنَـٰكُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَكُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَـٰرِهُونَ
rows.translation: We verily brought the Truth unto you, but ye were, most of you, averse to the Truth.
rows.transliteration: laqad ji-nākum bil ḥaqqi walākinna aktharakum lilḥaqqi kārihūn

rows.arabic: أَمْ أَبْرَمُوٓا۟ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّا مُبْرِمُونَ
rows.translation: Or do they determine any thing (against the Prophet)? Lo! We (also) are determining.
rows.transliteration: am abramū amran fa-innā mubrimūn

rows.arabic: أَمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّا لَا نَسْمَعُ سِرَّهُمْ وَنَجْوَىٰهُم ۚ بَلَىٰ وَرُسُلُنَا لَدَيْهِمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
rows.translation: Or deem they that We cannot hear their secret thoughts and private confidences? Nay, but Our envoys, present with them, do record.
rows.transliteration: am yaḥsabūna annā lā nasma`u sirrahum wanajwāhum ۚ balā warusulunā ladayhim yaktubūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ إِن كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ وَلَدٌ فَأَنَا۠ أَوَّلُ ٱلْعَـٰبِدِينَ
rows.translation: Say (O Muhammad): If the Beneficent One hath a son, then, I shall be first among the worshippers. (But there is no son).
rows.transliteration: qul in kāna lirraḥmāni waladun fa-ana awwalul `ābidīn

rows.arabic: سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَرْشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
rows.translation: Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, from that which they ascribe (unto Him)!
rows.transliteration: subḥāna rabbis samāwāti wal-arḍi rabbil `arshi `ammā yaṣifūn

rows.arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَـٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
rows.translation: So let them flounder (in their talk) and play until they meet the Day which they are promised.
rows.transliteration: fadharhum yakhūḍū wayal`abū ḥattā yulāqū yawmahumul ladhī yū`adūn

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِلَـٰهٌ وَفِى ٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَـٰهٌ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْحَكِيمُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
rows.translation: And He it is Who in the heaven is Allah, and in the earth Allah. He is the Wise, the Knower.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī fis samā-i ilāhun wafil-arḍi ilāh ۚ wahuwal ḥakīmul `alīm

rows.arabic: وَتَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَعِندَهُۥ عِلْمُ ٱلسَّاعَةِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
rows.translation: And blessed be He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and with Whom is knowledge of the Hour, and unto Whom ye will be returned.
rows.transliteration: watabārakal ladhī lahu mulkus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā wa`indahu `il-mus sā`ati wa ilayhi turja`ūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا يَمْلِكُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ ٱلشَّفَـٰعَةَ إِلَّا مَن شَهِدَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And those unto whom they cry instead of Him possess no power of intercession, saving him who beareth witness unto the Truth knowingly.
rows.transliteration: walā yamlikul ladhīna yad`ūna min dūnihish shafā`ata illā man shahida bil ḥaqqi wahum ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَهُمْ لَيَقُولُنَّ ٱللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
rows.translation: And if thou ask them who created them, they will surely say: Allah. How then are they turned away?
rows.transliteration: wala-in sa-altahum man khalaqahum layaqūlunnallāh ۖ fa-annā yu-fakūn

rows.arabic: وَقِيلِهِۦ يَـٰرَبِّ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوْمٌ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: And he saith: O my Lord! Lo! these are a folk who believe not.
rows.transliteration: waqīlihi yārabbi inna hā-ulā-i qawmul lā yu-minūn

rows.arabic: فَٱصْفَحْ عَنْهُمْ وَقُلْ سَلَـٰمٌ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Then bear with them (O Muhammad) and say: Peace. But they will come to know.
rows.transliteration: faṣfaḥ `anhum waqul salām ۚ fasawfa ya`lamūn
